meanings.sent1: The newspaper libelled the politician by spreading lies about him.
meanings.sent2: She was libelled by her jealous coworker who spread false rumors about her.
meanings.sent3: The comedian joked that his cat libelled him by telling the dog he was a scaredy-cat.
meanings.sent4: The internet trolls libelled the celebrity, painting her as a villain to their followers.
meanings.sent5: The villain in the movie libelled the hero, turning the whole town against him.

meanings.definition: Accused of a crime or wrongdoing
meanings.sent1: The libelled man protested his innocence, claiming he was framed.
meanings.sent2: The libelled student faced harsh judgment from his classmates after the false accusation.
meanings.sent3: The libelled cake was accused of being too sweet for the party, causing a dessert dilemma.
meanings.sent4: The libelled car sat in the garage, unjustly labeled as unreliable by its previous owner.
meanings.sent5: The libelled painting was mistaken for a forgery, tarnishing its artist's reputation.

meanings.definition: Made a false statement about someone to damage their reputation
meanings.sent1: The rival company libelled our brand in an attempt to steal our customers.
meanings.sent2: He libelled his ex-girlfriend online, spreading malicious lies to hurt her image.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous parrot libelled its owner by repeating made-up stories to the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The tabloid magazine libelled the actor, causing a public outcry against their false claims.
meanings.sent5: The vengeful neighbor libelled the gardener, accusing him of stealing plants to ruin his business.
